pullRequest.body:
Prove `(q ^ n).num = q.num ^ n` and `(q ^ n).den = q.den ^ n` by making those defeq. It is somewhat painful. `(q ^ n).den = q.den ^ n` is also defeq for `NNRat`, but not `(q ^ n).num = q.num ^ n` due to the `Int.natAbs` in the definition of `NNRat.num`.


---

Nice, this probably makes `^` on `Rat` computationally faster too.
This doesn't seem to match the `mul` lemmas; should we have `divInt_pow` instead to match `divInt_mul_divInt'`?
This matches `Rat.mul_def'` (which is getting renamed to a matching name in #12505). But also I was trying to prove `divInt_pow` and failed. I can try again.

super nit: I think this indent makes more sense
```suggestion
lemma pow_def (q : â„š) (n : â„•) :
  q ^ n = âŸ¨q.num ^ n, q.den ^ n, by simp [Nat.pow_eq_zero], by
    rw [Int.natAbs_pow]; exact q.reduced.pow _ _âŸ© := rfl
```
